chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

items.text: In thee, O LORD, do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.
items.plainText: In thee, O LORD, do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.

items.text: Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily: be thou my strong rock, for an house of defence to save me.
items.plainText: Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily: be thou my strong rock, for an house of defence to save me.

items.text: For thou art my rock and my fortress; therefore for thy name's sake lead me, and guide me.
items.plainText: For thou art my rock and my fortress; therefore for thy name's sake lead me, and guide me.

items.text: Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me: for thou art my strength.
items.plainText: Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me: for thou art my strength.

items.text: Into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O LORD God of truth.
items.plainText: Into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O LORD God of truth.

items.text: I have hated them that regard lying vanities: but I trust in the LORD.
items.plainText: I have hated them that regard lying vanities: but I trust in the LORD.

items.text: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;
items.plainText: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;

items.text: And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large room.
items.plainText: And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large room.

items.text: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am in trouble: mine eye is consumed with grief, yea, my soul and my belly.
items.plainText: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am in trouble: mine eye is consumed with grief, yea, my soul and my belly.

items.text: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing: my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are consumed.
items.plainText: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing: my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are consumed.

items.text: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me without fled from me.
items.plainText: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me without fled from me.

items.text: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.
items.plainText: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.

items.text: For I have heard the slander of many: fear was on every side: while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.
items.plainText: For I have heard the slander of many: fear was on every side: while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.

items.text: But I trusted in thee, O LORD: I said, Thou art my God.
items.plainText: But I trusted in thee, O LORD: I said, Thou art my God.

items.text: My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.
items.plainText: My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.

items.text: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: save me for thy mercies' sake.
items.plainText: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: save me for thy mercies' sake.

items.text: Let me not be ashamed, O LORD; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.
items.plainText: Let me not be ashamed, O LORD; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.

items.text: Let the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.
items.plainText: Let the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.

items.text: Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!
items.plainText: Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!

items.text: Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man: thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.
items.plainText: Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man: thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.

items.text: Blessed be the LORD: for he hath shewed me his marvellous kindness in a strong city.
items.plainText: Blessed be the LORD: for he hath shewed me his marvellous kindness in a strong city.

items.text: For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.
items.plainText: For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.

items.text: O love the LORD, all ye his saints: for the LORD preserveth the faithful, and plentifully rewardeth the proud doer.
items.plainText: O love the LORD, all ye his saints: for the LORD preserveth the faithful, and plentifully rewardeth the proud doer.

items.text: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the LORD.
items.plainText: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the LORD.
